description:
With a history that dates back to 1962, Friedman Law Offices in Lincoln, Nebraska, has provided unmatched counsel and support to clients throughout Lancaster County and all across the state for nearly 60 years. During this time, it has become one of the region's premier law firms for those who have suffered serious injuries or losses as results of someone else's negligent, careless or unlawful actions.

Over the course of their history handling personal injury and wrongful death claims, the law firm's attorneys have achieved remarkable success advocating on behalf of those in need. They have recovered millions of dollars in total compensation for their clients adversely affected by motor vehicle accidents, medical malpractice, dangerous drugs and medical devices, and other preventable tragedies.

In addition, they also handle workers' compensation claims, and they are fully committed to increasing your chances of securing the maximum dollar amount required for you to support yourself and your family while helping you obtain the justice you deserve. Honored for their outstanding professionalism and service, two of the firm's attorneys are AV Preeminent peer-review rated,* the highest rating, through Martindale-Hubbell, and our attorneys have earned memberships in the Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forum as well.

To begin the process of holding those responsible for your suffering accountable for their actions, you can contact Friedman Law Offices by phone or through the website to schedule a free initial consultation. The firm also offers virtual consultations in these uncertain times so that you do not have to further risk you health and safety to speak with an attorney.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer-review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingsTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
